FVG: Fair Value Gap - An imbalance in price where there is a gap between candles with no overlapping prices. Typically identified when a candle's wick doesn't fully overlap with adjacent candles. FVGs act as magnets for price and often get filled before major moves continue.
CVD: Cumulative Volume Delta - Running total of the difference between buying and selling volume. Calculated as (Buy Volume - Sell Volume) cumulatively. Divergences between CVD and price can signal potential reversals or confirm trends.
ICT: Inner Circle Trader - A trading methodology developed by Michael Huddleston focusing on market structure, liquidity, and institutional order flow. Key concepts include OTE (Optimal Trade Entry), liquidity sweeps, and market maker patterns.
OTE: Optimal Trade Entry - A specific Fibonacci retracement level (typically 62-79%) where ICT traders look for entries in the direction of higher timeframe bias.
Liquidity Sweep: When price moves beyond a recent high or low to trigger stop losses and grab liquidity before reversing in the opposite direction. Often seen at support/resistance levels.
Order Block: A consolidation area before a strong impulsive move, representing potential institutional order placement. Acts as support/resistance on retests.
Kill Zone: Specific time windows with high probability for institutional activity. Primary kill zones: 02:00-04:00 EST (London open) and 09:30-10:30 EST (NY open).
PO3: Power of 3 - ICT concept involving three phases: accumulation, manipulation, and distribution. Used to identify potential market turning points.
BPR: Break and Retest - Price breaks a level, then returns to test it before continuing. Common entry pattern.
funding_rate: Periodic payment between long and short traders in perpetual futures. Positive = longs pay shorts, negative = shorts pay longs. Paid every 8 hours on most exchanges (00:00, 08:00, 16:00 UTC).
overnight_margin: Additional margin requirement to hold positions overnight. Varies by broker but typically 2-4 hours before market close. Forces position closure for undercapitalized traders.
liquidation_cascade: Chain reaction of liquidations where one forced liquidation pushes price further, triggering more liquidations. Creates extreme volatility and V-shaped reversals.
perpetual_futures: Futures contracts with no expiration date, using funding rate mechanism to peg to spot price. Common in crypto markets.
margin_call: When account equity falls below maintenance margin, requiring additional funds or position reduction.
VWAP: Volume Weighted Average Price - Average price weighted by volume. Institutional benchmark for fair value.
delta: Net difference between buying and selling volume at each price level. Positive delta = more buyers, negative = more sellers.
footprint_chart: Chart showing volume at each price level within a candle, revealing buying/selling pressure distribution.
imbalance: Significant difference between buy and sell volume at a price level, often indicating institutional activity.
liquidity_void: Area on chart with little trading activity, often created by gaps or fast moves. Acts as price magnet.
mitigation: When price returns to fill a Fair Value Gap or test an Order Block. Completes the market structure.
premium: When futures trade above spot price, indicating bullish sentiment or cost of carry.
discount: When futures trade below spot price, indicating bearish sentiment.
contango: Futures curve where longer-dated contracts trade at premium to near-dated. Normal in commodities.
backwardation: Futures curve where near-dated contracts trade at premium to longer-dated. Indicates supply shortage or high demand for immediate delivery.
open_interest: Total number of outstanding derivative contracts. Increasing OI with price = new money entering, decreasing OI = positions closing.
basis: Difference between futures and spot price. Basis trading exploits convergence at expiration.
time_based_stop: Stop loss based on time rather than price. If trade doesn't work within X minutes/hours, exit regardless of P&L.
tick: Minimum price movement. NQ = 0.25 points ($5 per tick for MNQ).
point_value: Dollar value of one point move. MNQ = $20 per point, MES = $5 per point.
session_close: Official market close time. Equities: 16:00 EST, Crypto: never (24/7).
settlement: Official closing price for margin calculations. Usually VWAP of last 30 seconds.
rollover: Switching from expiring contract to next front month. Creates volume patterns.
front_month: Most actively traded contract month with highest volume and open interest.
back_month: Less active contract months further from expiration.
calendar_spread: Simultaneous long/short of different expiration months. Exploits term structure changes.
term_structure: Relationship between futures prices across different expiration dates.
cost_of_carry: Storage, financing, and insurance costs built into futures prices.
convergence: Futures price approaching spot price as expiration nears. Basis goes to zero.
delivery: Physical or cash settlement of futures contract at expiration.
cash_settled: Futures settled in cash rather than physical delivery (most financial futures).
physical_delivery: Actual exchange of underlying commodity (oil, gold, agricultural products).
position_limit: Maximum number of contracts a trader can hold, set by exchanges.
reportable_position: Position size requiring reporting to regulators (usually 25+ contracts).
speculator: Trader taking directional risk for profit, not hedging underlying exposure.
hedger: Trader using futures to offset risk in underlying business (farmers, manufacturers).
COT_report: Commitments of Traders report showing positioning of hedgers, speculators, small traders.
smart_money: Institutional traders with superior information and execution. Often tracked via COT reports.
dumb_money: Retail traders who tend to be wrong at extremes. Contrarian indicator.
sentiment: Overall market attitude (bullish/bearish). Measured by surveys, positioning, put/call ratios.
contrarian: Trading against the crowd, based on belief that extremes in sentiment signal reversals.
mean_reversion: Strategy betting that prices return to average. Works in range-bound markets.
momentum: Strategy following trend. Works in trending markets, fails at reversals.
breakout: Entering when price breaks key level. Risk: false breakouts and liquidity grabs.
fade: Trading against the move, expecting reversal. High risk, requires precise timing.
scalp: Very short-term trades for small profits. Requires low commissions and fast execution.
swing_trade: Holding positions for days to weeks. Captures larger moves, lower time commitment.
position_trade: Long-term trades lasting weeks to months. Based on fundamental or macro trends.
risk_reward: Ratio of potential profit to potential loss. Minimum 2:1 recommended.
position_sizing: Determining how many contracts/shares to trade based on risk tolerance and account size.
max_drawdown: Largest peak-to-trough decline. Key metric for strategy evaluation.
win_rate: Percentage of profitable trades. Less important than risk:reward.
expectancy: Average profit per trade. (Win% × Avg Win) - (Loss% × Avg Loss).
edge: Statistical advantage that generates positive expectancy over many trades.
